content:
Looking at Fintype/Finset right now, curious to see that choosefunctions want a decidable proof of unique existence. I assume it's there for purity, since sets are defined as equivalence classes over permutations, but it has me wondering, how would I go about choosing the minimal satisfiable element from a e.g. Fintype + TotalOrder?

On a tangentially related note, is there a version of Range that would give me an iteration variable together with proof that it's in range? (of type Subtype)
Alex Mobius has marked this topic as resolved.
